entry.title: https://github.com/guzba/zippy
entry.content: Pure Nim implementation of deflate, zlib, gzip and zip.

entry.title: https://github.com/nim-lang/atlas
entry.content: The Atlas Package cloner. It manages an isolated workspace that contains projects and dependencies.

entry.title: https://github.com/nim-lang/nimforum
entry.content: Lightweight alternative to Discourse written in Nim

entry.title: https://github.com/dom96/jester
entry.content: A sinatra-like web framework for Nim.

entry.title: https://github.com/status-im/nimbus-eth1
entry.content: Nimbus: an Ethereum Execution Client for Resource-Restricted Devices

entry.title: https://github.com/crashappsec/chalk
entry.content: Chalk allows you to follow code from development, through builds and into production.

entry.title: https://github.com/nim-lang/langserver
entry.content: The Nim language server implementation (based on nimsuggest)

entry.title: https://github.com/nim-lang/nimony
entry.content: Nimony is a new Nim implementation that is in heavy development.

entry.title: https://github.com/nim-lang/Nim
entry.content: Nim is a statically typed compiled systems programming language. It combines successful concepts from mature languages like Python, Ada and Modula. Its design focuses on efficiency, expressiveness, and elegance (in that order of priority).
